intro: Gerbera hypochaeridoides, commonly known as the African gerbera, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers with bright yellow centers and white or pink petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens. Gerbera hypochaeridoides is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
